subject: Technology
title: Mobile Passes Desktop
description: A 60-second lesson on Mobile Passes Desktop.

hook.text: For decades, the personal computer was king. Then a quiet shift happened around 2016.

buildup.text: More people worldwide accessed the internet from phones than from desktops for the first time.

discovery.text: In many countries, the smartphone was not a second screen. It was the only screen.

twist.text: Billions of people skipped PCs entirely. Their first computer was a phone in their pocket.

climax.text: Websites scrambled to redesign for small screens. 'Mobile-first' became the new standard.

punchline.text: The PC era didn't end. It just moved to your pocket.

quiz.question: What happened around 2016 in internet usage?
options: Mobile internet surpassed desktop for the first time
